alert.note: Alert for Haskell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 08 at 8:33PM CST until March 08 at 10:15PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN HASKELL COUNTY... At 829 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated isolated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area...from southwest of Haskell to Haskell to Irby. Between 3 and 5.5 inches of rain have fallen from Sagerton to Haskell to Irby. The heaviest radar estimated rainfall was near Sagerton. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Haskell, Stamford, Paint Creek, Irby and Sagerton. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... County Road 279 crossing North Paint Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
